transcript.content: I think we beat the second language by about double, I think in English we have got about, I think, Russian is second, but I think we got twice as many words. So there are obviously things that we say that cannot really be translated.
And so, you know, ours is just great for obviously poetry and...
It makes sense when you think about things like blancmange.
But I think if ever - I don't know how many there are some[inaudible] - say there's about a hundred thousand possibilities, right?
I think we probably know, as educated people like us Steve, We probably have about 20,000.
Right? I really don't think we need that other $80,000.

I can't, I'm not walking around going. I don't know what they're talking about. I'm really... what did he say? what is that? I mean that happens possibly once or twice a year when I go - "wh... sorry. What does that what does that mean?"
Do you know what I mean? - Karl you look bored mate? We had a real conversation there...
I think he switched off when I said "forsooth"
(Bruce Forsyth impression) "alright, alright, so much better than last week!", you know him, don't you, Karl?
Put a song song on, yeah?
Yeah bored? Okay. There's a monkey, right?
Ah ok now he's perked up.
It was a professor of English,
No Blue Sky - The Thorns, that's beautiful, isn't it on Xfm 104.9 Karl!
You're losing your rag a little bit. What's the matter?
What's the matter, no go on what's the matter?
I've got something to cheer him up. Someone's e-mailed in - Emma's emailed in. She said that for those that know, those in the know, they refer to Lanzarote as Lanza grotty.
He's a bit fed-up, he's got two CDs for Christmas from a company that's been with just six years. He's a little bit grumpy, about having to answer the phones.
He wouldn't go and make Steve another cup of tea immediately.
Nothing, go on what are we doing?
Come on Karl, you get paid for this - (clapping) PROJECT. OUT.
We'll take one of those CDs away.
What were we talking about? Lord of the Rings.

Sick of it, as I say. Um, so there's people dressed up on TV. They were dressed up as the characters. They were... they're sort of costumes. There's a guy I went to University with, I don't to mention his name - went into his room once, he is into that sort of thing, in the... he showed me his wardrobe. We had a full-size Star Trek outfit.
That him mum had made for him.
That him mum had made for him!
But I wanted to say - well A why are you taking it to University but B, when are you going to wear that?
When are you ever in the mood to wear that?
Whoa, you know, you never know when uhh, you know, like in Apollo 13 was it when someone had measles or something. Someone else go it.
So he might go - oh, I can't believe it.
I can't believe it. The Enterprise ayyeeye. Uhura can't make it.

But it's the idea of that being, you know, I'm not want to speak, but it's that idea of that being attractive to women because that's presumably generally when you're at university when you're 18 - 19. That's the reason you wear these kind of clothes, is to try and make a bond with someone, isn't it? Try and establish some kind of connection.
That... this is what annoyed me though, there was something about a woman who's going up Everest on a bike.
Do you know what I mean? And they were like "oh, brilliant", but I don't think that's that good. When someone's done it walking... doing it on a bike's easier, won't it.
Where would the... where would the woman... where would the woman who complained about you come? In the year's chart?
Yeah, that's the woman with the enormous head.
She took offence to some of the comments you made on the show, and rightly so.
... yeah, I can understand, I was out of order. And, you know... so I'm sorry about that.
Yeah. Well yeah, well, I just wanna explain again that Karl... I mean, it was a... it was a... it's... Freak of the Week is sort of like more of a punchy catchphrase than... than a derogatory term.
And Karl's fascination and childlike... I mean, I think we'd have to include Karl in the roundup.
I mean, he'd be... certainly be in the top ten.
Well I think the fact... I think the fact that she didn't sort of...
... pursue any official complaints means that, you know, she's a bigger person than you, Karl...
... she is... um... Karl, you were gonna do some news stories, I think.
What do you want? Well, like I say, there hasn't been that much going on...
... there's this story about a fella who, uh... hasn't eaten for seventy years.
He hasn't eaten, is that all... that's all the information you're gonna give us?
Yeah, hasn't eaten for seventy years...
... uh... hasn't had a drink, but he's alright.
Next. Well, what... well what is... how is that? How has a man not eaten or drank for seventy years?
It's that thing, innit? Your belly gets used to it, or something.
Steve. Has he misinterpreted it or is it rubbish?
It... well, it, to be honest with you, it doesn't actually offer any explanation, it just says that... that's what happened.
It doesn't... it doesn't go on to anything else.
Um... a woman's had six organs transplanted. Um...
... woman needed a new kidney, a new heart, a new stomach, a new liver... uh... new kidney... intestine...
Does that mean that she's the same woman?
You'd just say "forget it", wouldn't you?
Well, not really. You know, the organ is just a... lump of tissue...
If you're that... if you're that knackered, call it a day, I reckon.
And there's a woman... there's a woman who, um... who hasn't slept for eight years as well.
Again... do you want to see that, Steve...
Let's have a look at this...
So that's... that's the news for the week.
Next... do you wanna apologise once more for anyone you might have offended over the year?
Yeah, like I say, I always... I never want to upset anyone.
We're just chatting about stuff that's fascinating to me.
... he's just chatting, it's from the heart, you've seen something, you say "oh, that looks a bit like so-and-so", or "isn't it a bit...", you're not really, you know...
... you don't really try and hurt anyone's feelings, do you?
But I think... I think most people know that.
And I mean... and I've gotta apologise for laughing at anything...
Get people in the Christmas mood and that.
Yeah! You have, yeah. You have got people in the Christmas mood.
It's you in the film Scrooge.
Is it... if it's just you moaning with bells, I'll be annoyed. Right, go on then.
Right, Scrooge, listen to this, and then there's some question at the end...
... and you can win some stuff and that.
Clock chiming. Paper rustling. Whistling. Sound of door closing.
What do you mean by coming in here at this time of day? Hmm?
I've just... I've just been doing some Christmas shopping, haven't I?
Probably do some more shopping on Monday 'cause... it's my day off, innit?
Yes, I know it is, you don't have to tell me.
Do you want to see what I've bought Suzanne?
I don't mind showing you, it's only... only a Christmas present, innit.
Bought her some more, uh... bought her some more condoms.
Well, I bought her some last year, got her two boxes. Uh... they all got used, so.
I am very glad to hear it.
How much do I pay you?

Why are you asking... the presents I buy her's got nothing to do with what I earn. Like I say, if, uh... if I won the lottery, I wouldn't go mental on her, do you know what I mean? I probably wouldn't even tell her because I think she'd wanna travel 'round the world and all that, and I'm not into that to be honest, so... I'd probably keep it quiet.
... once you've been 'round the world, where do you go next year?
Each to their own though innit, do you know what I mean?

What... what, for Christmas? Not that fussed, really. And it's just as well I'm not that fussed, 'cause do you know how I do some work at, um... at XFM? Do you know what they're giving me for... for Christmas present?
No. Might as well have been nothing. Um... two CDs.
They give you a list of about thirty albums, and you get to pick two off the list. So I've gone for, um... Kings of Leon album and, uh... the Best of Bob Marley.
Mr. Marley has been dead these seven years. In fact, he died seven years ago this very day.
Do you know, uh... do you know what sort of doughnuts Bob Marley likes?
No, it's... it's not a proper question, it's an old Peter Kay joke - he likes the ones with Jammin'.
